byline.contributor: Edy Yin and Mia Li contributed research.

abstract: Hit-and-run accident in Guangdong Province, China, in which at least 18 passers-by ignored seriously injured toddler, is prompting discussions about whether Chinese society discourages altruism and compassion.
snippet: A hit-and-run accident in which passers-by ignored an injured child has prompted discussions about whether Chinese society discourages altruism and compassion.
lead_paragraph: A hit-and-run accident in which passers-by ignored an injured child has prompted discussions about whether Chinese society discourages altruism and compassion.

headline.main: Bystanders’ Neglect of Injured Toddler Sets Off Soul-Searching on Web Sites in China
headline.print_headline: Bystanders’ Neglect of Injured Toddler Sets Off Soul-Searching on Web Sites in China
headline.seo: Toddler’s Accident Sets Off Soul-Searching in China
